Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto outdueled Yu Darvish in a historic postseason matchup of Japanese-born starters
Kiké Hernández hit a home run in the second inning
Teoscar Hernández hit a home run in the seventh inning
The Padres went scoreless for the final 24 innings of the series
The teams combined to retire 26 consecutive batters — the longest streak in a single game in postseason history
Pre-Game Insights: The Los Angeles Dodgers signed Yoshinobu Yamamoto to a $325 million, 12-year deal in December
The Dodgers will play the wild-card New York Mets in the best-of-seven NLCS starting Sunday in Los Angeles
The Padres' big hitters went bust with their season on the line
Yu Darvish gave up an early home run to Kiké Hernández, then set down 14 in a row
Teoscar Hernández’s homer chased Darvish in the seventh and made it 2-0
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman expressed satisfaction after the win
Mookie Betts reflected on the team's journey and resilience
Manager Dave Roberts highlighted the team's performance and readiness for the next level
Miscellaneous Highlights: Clayton Kershaw, Gavin Lux, Kopech, Walker Buehler and Tyler Glasnow huddled in a corner smoking victory cigars
Ohtani hit a tying three-run homer in Game 1, his playoff debut
The Padres became the first team to lead 2-1 in a best-of-five series and fail to push across a run in the final two games
Others: Los Angeles led 1-0 on the drive by Kiké Hernández with two outs in the second
The public-address announcer warned fans in the middle of the fifth Friday not to throw objects or go on the field
Vesia complained of cramping and will have X-rays and an MRI
The Padres head into the offseason with plenty of promise for next year
